wikipedia_page.main: Major General Sir Alexander Bruce Tulloch,  (2 September 1838 – 26 May 1920) was a British Army officer who served as military commandant for the Colony of Victoria, a war correspondent and an author.

response: *1918–1920: Maj-Gen. Sir Alexander Bruce Tulloch, KCB, CMG
On 20 September 1889, Alexander Bruce Tulloch was appointed Commandant of the Victorian Military Forces, with the local rank of Major-General.
*Alexander Bruce Tulloch (1838–1920), Major-general in the British Army, author
*Major-General Alexander Bruce Tulloch  Commandant of the Military Forces of the Colony of Victoria.
